channel.title: Changing item names
channel.description:
Is the item name stored in the client or the server?
I tried changing it in items.cfg but they didn't change ingame.

item.title: Changing item names
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:6, topic:260231”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=343560.msg2653630#msg2653630 date=1233699059]

The client I use for my server is not open source.

Does converting .class to .java lose any information, or mess it up? And any recommended programs to do this?

Yes, you need to use a decompiler.
[/quote]
Decompiler = pretty much guranteed 100 errors.[/quote]

That’s because it doesn’t usually transfer all of the byte code.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing item names
item.dc:creator: @Zillionair1 Zillionair1
item.description:
@Zillionair1 wrote:

Its in the Class 8.java in your client files.

      if(i == id here)
        {
            class8.aString170 = "Name Here";
            class8.aByteArray178 = "Examine.".getBytes();
        }
[/code] add this under
[code]     public static final Class8 method198(int i)
    {
        for(int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
            if(aClass8Array172[j].anInt157 == i)
                return aClass8Array172[j];

        anInt180 = (anInt180 + 1) % 10;
        Class8 class8 = aClass8Array172[anInt180];
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183.anInt1406 = anIntArray195[i];
        class8.anInt157 = i;
        class8.method197();
        class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);
